alert.note: Alert for Ohio; Simpson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 10:58PM EDT until March 28 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, NORTHWEST Kentucky, SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky and south central Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Breckinridge. In NORTHWEST Kentucky, Ohio. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Grayson and Logan. In south central Kentucky, Butler, Edmonson, Simpson and Warren. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 958 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bowling Green, Russellville, Hartford, Morgantown, Plum Springs, Crestmoor, Memphis Junction, Mount Victor, Anderson and Casey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
